Sample from Cuadras-Auge distribution

Source: R/sample.R
rmo_esm_cuadras_auge.Rd

Draws n independent samples from a d variate Cuadras-Augé distribution with parameters alpha and beta.

rcamo_esm(n, d, alpha, beta)

Arguments

n

number of samples
d

dimension
alpha

rate of individual shocks
beta

rate of global shock

Value

rmo_esm_cuadras_auge implements an optimized version of the exogenous shock model representation for the Cuadras-Augé family and returns an \(n \times d\) array matrix with rows corresponding to the independent samples of size \(d\).

Details

  • alpha is the shock intensity of shocks that affect only single components.

  • beta is the shock intensity of the global shock that affects all components.

See also

rmo_esm

Other samplers: rexmo_markovian(), rextmo_lfm(), rmo_esm()

Examples

rcamo_esm(10L, 2L, 0.5, 0.2)

#>             [,1]       [,2]
#>  [1,] 1.90007235 1.26475073
#>  [2,] 0.05340894 0.45915438
#>  [3,] 4.26007487 0.28624337
#>  [4,] 0.76287641 1.77988059
#>  [5,] 5.32719374 1.09920633
#>  [6,] 2.54314700 0.88122313
#>  [7,] 0.15497372 0.07840685
#>  [8,] 0.46367619 0.23034913
#>  [9,] 0.60800074 0.57180879
#> [10,] 1.38281422 0.05287436
rcamo_esm(10L, 2L, 0, 1)      ## comonotone

#>             [,1]       [,2]
#>  [1,] 0.15210404 0.15210404
#>  [2,] 1.01687513 1.01687513
#>  [3,] 1.80836899 1.80836899
#>  [4,] 1.14321240 1.14321240
#>  [5,] 1.25896015 1.25896015
#>  [6,] 0.09659652 0.09659652
#>  [7,] 0.76962200 0.76962200
#>  [8,] 0.06768541 0.06768541
#>  [9,] 0.47850159 0.47850159
#> [10,] 0.43904557 0.43904557
rcamo_esm(10L, 2L, 1, 0)      ## independence

#>            [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] 0.7510749 0.3477127
#>  [2,] 2.0632670 0.3808103
#>  [3,] 1.9443705 0.5643083
#>  [4,] 4.2174098 2.8622615
#>  [5,] 0.9369852 0.5694194
#>  [6,] 0.8147494 1.7085647
#>  [7,] 1.1690024 0.5546123
#>  [8,] 2.5386571 0.4852478
#>  [9,] 1.2798431 0.8772601
#> [10,] 0.4858480 0.7084776
